title: Garndiffaith
text: Garndiffaith is a village located in Torfaen, south east Wales.

title: Garndiffaith
text: It is a small rural area situated between Talywain and Varteg, three miles north of the town of Pontypool and 3.5 miles south of the town of Blaenavon( a World Heritage Site).

title: Garndiffaith
text: The village is now part of the Abersychan suburb of Pontypool which also includes Cwmavon, Pentwyn, Talywain, Varteg, and Victoria Village.

title: Garndiffaith
text: Situated near the old British coal mines and works, the Garndiffaith area is renowned for its agricultural and industrial heritage based on mining of iron and coal.

title: Garndiffaith
text: The adjacent former British Coal Corporation land is known as' The Balance' after the Water Balance winding mechanism.

title: Garndiffaith
text: Garndiffaith has a few small shops, a Public house and a police station.

title: Garndiffaith
text: Garnteg has been the local primary school since it was opened in 1995, when Varteg and Garndiffaith primary schools merged.

title: Garndiffaith
text: Garndiffaith primary was later demolished and a new community hall was opened on the site.

title: Garndiffaith
text: Garndiffaith RFC is a long established rugby union club currently playing in the Welsh Rugby Union League 1 East.

title: Garndiffaith
text: A history group has recently been set up to research the history of the club and a local community website has been set up to cover the area.

title: Limestone Coast
text: The Limestone Coast is a name used since the early twenty- first century for a South Australian government region located in the south east of South Australia which immediately adjoins the continental coastline and the Victorian border.

title: Limestone Coast
text: The name is also used for a tourist region and a wine zone both located in the same part of South Australia.

title: Jawty
text: Jawty is part of the name of two villages, both located in Gmina Susz, within Iława County, Warmian- Masurian Voivodeship, Poland:

title: Llandybie
text: Llandybie(" Saint Tybie's church") is a community which includes a large village of the same name situated two miles north of Ammanford in Carmarthenshire, Wales.

title: Llandybie
text: According to the United Kingdom Census 2001, Llandybie village itself is home to a population of 3,800, while the community – which also includes the villages of Blaenau, Caerbryn, Capel Hendre, Cwmgwili, Pentregwenlais, Penybanc, Pen- y- groes, and Saron – has 8,800 inhabitants, increasing to 10,994 at the 2011 census.

title: Llandybie
text: It was in Llandybie, in 1943, that the mineral Brammallite was found for the first time.

title: Llandybie
text: Llandybie hosted the National Eisteddfod of Wales in 1944.

title: Llandybie
text: The village is served by Llandybie railway station on the Heart of Wales Line and the A483 road which is the main road.

title: Llandybie
text: Llandybie Community Primary School is located in the north- easterly fringe of the village.

title: Llandybie
text: The community is bordered by the communities of: Dyffryn Cennen; Cwmamman; Betws; Ammanford; Llanedi; Llannon; Gorslas; and Llanfihangel Aberbythych, all being in Carmarthenshire.

title: Teresa Freeman-Grenville, 13th Lady Kinloss
text: She is the heir- general of Lady Catherine Grey, sister of Lady Jane Grey, briefly Queen of England after the death of King Edward VI, and has thus been suggested as a claimant to the throne of England.

title: Frances Grey, Duchess of Suffolk
text: Frances Grey, Duchess of Suffolk (née Brandon; 16 July 1517 – 20 November 1559), was an English noblewoman, the second child and eldest daughter of King Henry VIII's younger sister, Princess Mary, and Charles Brandon, 1st Duke of Suffolk.

title: Frances Grey, Duchess of Suffolk
text: She was the mother of Lady Jane Grey, de facto Queen of England and Ireland from 10 July until 19 July 1553, as well as Lady Katherine Grey and Lady Mary Grey.

title: Katherine Grant, 12th Countess of Dysart
text: Katherine Grant of Rothiemurchus, 12th Countess of Dysart( 1 June 1918 – 8 November 2011) was a Scottish peer.

title: Katherine Grant, 12th Countess of Dysart
text: She was born Katherine Greaves, daughter of Wenefryde Agatha Greaves, who succeeded as 10th Countess of Dysart( 1889 – 1975) in 1935 and Major Owain Edward Whitehead Greaves.

title: Katherine Grant, 12th Countess of Dysart
text: On her mother's death Lady Katherine's elder sister, Lady Rosamund Agnes( 1914–2003) became the 11th Countess of Dysart, but never married or had issue, on her death in December 2003 Lady Katherine succeeded to the titles of Countess of Dysart and Lady Huntingtower.

title: Katherine Grant, 12th Countess of Dysart
text: Under the Scottish peerage tradition, it is a title that goes to an eldest daughter if there is no male child.

title: Katherine Grant, 12th Countess of Dysart
text: It has moved from earl to countess for centuries. Hence, after Lady Katherine ’s death, her son Johnnie( John Peter Grant) took on the title 13th Earl of Dysart while his son James became Lord Huntingtower.

title: Katherine Grant, 12th Countess of Dysart
text: The Huntingtower title, which also shifts between male and female offspring, is more of a nominal one chosen by one of Lady Grant ’s ancestors, none of whom, it seems, ever lived at Huntingtower, on the western edge of Perth.

title: Katherine Grant, 12th Countess of Dysart
text: During the Second World War, the Countess married an outstanding soldier, Lieutenant- Colonel John Peter Grant younger of Rothiemurchus in 1941( 1915 – 1987) who succeeded his father as 15th Grant of Rothiemurchus.

title: Katherine Grant, 12th Countess of Dysart
text: They had two children: She died in 2011, aged 93.

text: Bernard Bonvoisin, known as Bernie Bonvoisin( born 9 July 1956 in Nanterre, Hauts- de- Seine), is a French hard rock singer and film director.

title: Bernie Bonvoisin
text: He was one of the best friends of Bon Scott the singer of AC/ DC and together they recorded the song" Ride On" which was one of the last songs by Bon Scott.

title: Tupac Shakur
text: Tupac Amaru Shakur (born Lesane Parish Crooks, June 16, 1971September 13, 1996), popularly known by his stage name 2Pac, was an American rapper and actor.

title: Tupac Shakur
text: He is considered by many as one of the most significant rappers of all time.

title: Tupac Shakur
text: Much of Shakur's work has been noted for addressing contemporary social issues that plagued inner cities, and he is considered a symbol of resistance and activism against inequality.

title: Tupac Shakur
text: Shakur was born in the Manhattan borough of New York City but relocated to the San Francisco Bay Area in 1988.

title: Tupac Shakur
text: He later moved to Los Angeles in 1993 to further pursue his music career.

title: Tupac Shakur
text: By the time he released his debut album "2Pacalypse Now" in 1991, he had become a central figure in West Coast hip hop, introducing social issues in the genre at a time when gangsta rap was dominant in the mainstream.

title: Tupac Shakur
text: Shakur achieved further critical and commercial success with his follow-up albums "Strictly 4 My N.I.G.G.A.Z...

title: Tupac Shakur
text: " (1993) and the critically acclaimed "Me Against the World" (1995), which has been considered as his magnum opus.

title: Tupac Shakur

title: Tupac Shakur

title: T. V. Chandran
text: T. V. Chandran( born 23 November 1950) is an Indian film director, screenwriter, and actor, predominantly working in Malayalam cinema.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Born in a Malayali family in Telicherry, Chandran worked as a Reserve Bank of India employee before entering into the film industry.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: He started his film career as an assistant director to P. A. Backer.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: He also acted the lead role in Backer's highly acclaimed political drama" Kabani Nadi Chuvannappol"( 1975).

title: T. V. Chandran
text: He made his directorial debut with the unreleased feature" Krishnan Kutty"( 1981), and followed this with the Tamil film" Hemavin Kadhalargal"( 1985).

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Chandran came into prominence after" Alicinte Anveshanam"( 1989), which was nominated for the Golden Leopard at the Locarno International Film Festival.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: This was followed with" Ponthan Mada"( 1993), his most famous film to- date.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Chandran is most known for his art- house films which have references to history and undertones of politics and feminism.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: He is also known for his trilogy on 2002 Gujarat riots, consisting of" Kathavasheshan"( 2004)," Vilapangalkappuram"( 2008) and" Bhoomiyude Avakashikal"( 2012).

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Other highly acclaimed films include" Mangamma"( 1997)," Dany"( 2001) and( 2003).

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Chandran is widely regarded as one of the finest directors in Indian cinema and is widely credited with having revolutionised parallel cinema with his complex- structured art- house films.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Chandran has won several film awards including six National Film Awards and ten Kerala State Film Awards.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: In addition to these, he is a recipient of a number of awards at various International film festivals.

text: Hans Folke" Hasse" Alfredson( 28 June 1931 – 10 September 2017) was a Swedish actor, film director, writer and comedian.

title: Hans Alfredson
text: He was born in Malmö, Sweden.

title: Hans Alfredson
text: He is known for his collaboration with Tage Danielsson as the duo Hasse& Tage and their production company AB Svenska Ord(" Swedish Words Ltd").

title: Hans Alfredson
text: His most celebrated contribution to their brand of" humorist humanism" was his ability to extemporize wildly absurd comic situations, for example in the Lindeman dialogues.

title: Hans Alfredson
text: Already in 1970 he gave a taste of another and less comedic side in the role as an rather unpleasant civil servant in Grisjakten.

title: Hans Alfredson
text: As time went by, Alfredson more or less totally turned around to become a serious author and film director.

title: Hans Alfredson
text: In 1982 he both directed and participated in the film The Simple- Minded Murderer, a motion picture based on his own novel" En ond man An evil man").

title: Hans Alfredson
text: Here Alfredson portrayed a rich and indeed very unpleasant manufacturer and Nazi-supporter who tormented the inhabitants of his native Scanian country- side in the 1930's.

title: Hans Alfredson
text: With just a brief return to a revue comedy in 1984, he never returned to that genre after the 1985 death of Tage Danielsson.

title: Hans Alfredson
text: Between 1992 and 1994 he was manager of the cultural museum" Skansen" at Stockholm.

title: Hans Alfredson
text: In the mid- zeroes he participated in the Danish criminal- odyssey The Eagle, and his last cinematic work came with the 2009 The Girl Who Kicked the Hornets' Nest.

title: Hans Alfredson
text: A film directed by one of his two sons, Daniel Alfredson.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: Djadoeg Djajakusuma ( 1 August 1918 – 28 October 1987) was an Indonesian film director and promoter of traditional art forms.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: Born to a nobleman and his wife in Temanggung, Central Java, Djajakusuma became interested in the arts at a young age, choosing to pursue a career in theatre.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: During the Japanese occupation from 1943 to 1945 he was a translator and actor, and in the four- year national revolution which followed he worked for the military's educational division, several news agencies, and in drama.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: In 1951, Djajakusuma joined the National Film Corporation( Perfini) at the invitation of Usmar Ismail.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: After making his directorial debut with" Embun", Djajakusuma released a further eleven films with the company before leaving in 1964.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: He then returned to traditional Indonesian theatre, including" wayang".

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: Although he continued to direct movies independently of Perfini, most of his energies were dedicated to promoting traditional art forms and teaching cinematography.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: After over a decade of poor health and high blood pressure, Djajakusuma collapsed during a ceremony and died.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: He was buried in Karet Bivak Cemetery.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: The dedicated but easily angered Djajakusuma was influenced by Usmar Ismail's realist views, although he focused more on traditional aspects of life.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: His theatrical performances attempted to modernize traditional forms so that they could be better received in a modern world.

title: D. Djajakusuma
text: He is credited with revitalising the Betawi theatre form" lenong" and received numerous awards for his filmmaking, including a lifetime achievement award at the Indonesian Film Festival.

title: Hedwig Jagiellon, Electress of Brandenburg
text: Hedwig Jagiellon (15 March 1513 – 7 February 1573) was a Polish princess, the daughter of Sigismund I the Old of Poland and Electress of Brandenburg by marriage to Joachim II Hector, Elector of Brandenburg.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: Sigismund I the Old (1 January 1467 – 1 April 1548) was King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania from 1506 until his death in 1548.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: Sigismund I was a member of the Jagiellonian dynasty, the son of Casimir IV and younger brother of kings John I Albert and Alexander I Jagiellon.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: He was nicknamed "the Old" in later historiography to distinguish him from his son and successor, Sigismund II Augustus.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: Sigismund was born in the town of Kozienice in 1467 as the fifth son of Casimir IV and his wife Elizabeth of Austria.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: He was one of thirteen children and was not expected to assume the throne after his father.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: Sigismund's eldest brother and rightful heir Vladislaus II instead became the King of Bohemia, Hungary and Croatia as the successor to George of Poděbrady in Bohemia and then to Matthias Corvinus in Hungary, thus temporarily uniting these kingdoms.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: When Casimir died, the Polish-Lithuanian realm was divided between the remaining two older sons, with John Albert being crowned King of Poland, and Alexander as Grand Duke of Lithuania.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: Alexander inherited Poland following John Albert's sudden death in 1501. Hence, Sigismund's reign only began when he succeeded Alexander to both titles in 1506 at the age of 39.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: A capable monarch and a patron of arts, Sigismund established Polish rule over Ducal Prussia and annexed the Duchy of Mazovia with Warsaw, whilst retaining the nation's wealth and prominence in the region.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: He assured that his nephew Albert, Duke of Prussia, and his Protestant successors will pay a feudal homage or tribute to Polish monarchs as a sign of political and diplomatic dependence.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: This was observed until the Treaty of Bromberg in 1657 when Prussia gained its sovereignty.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: Sigismund and commander Jan Amor Tarnowski also defeated Moldavia at Obertyn in 1531 and Muscovy in 1535, thereby strengthening the country's eastern borders.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: His 42-year reign was further marked by decisive contributions to Polish architecture, cuisine, language and customs, especially at the behest of his second wife, the Italian-born Bona Sforza.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: Italian styles and fashions dominated at the height of the Polish Renaissance and Polish Golden Age, which developed the Roman Catholic identity of Poland.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: He was commemorated on a contemporary 200-złoty banknote.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: Sigismund was married twice, first to noblewoman Barbara Zápolya from Hungary and then to Bona Sforza, the daughter of Gian Galeazzo Sforza, Duke of Milan.

title: Sigismund I the Old
text: Their only son and the last Jagiellon king, Sigismund Augustus, was co-crowned "vivente rege" in 1529 and formally assumed throne when Sigismund the Old died in 1548.

title: Catherine of Brandenburg-Küstrin
text: Catherine of Brandenburg- Küstrin( 10 August 1549 – 30 September 1602) was a Margravine of Brandenburg- Küstrin by birth and Electress of Brandenburg by marriage.

title: Hans Krell
text: Hans Krell( c.

title: Hans Krell
text: 1490-1565 or 1586), also Krehl ou Kreil, was a German painter of the Renaissance, mainly known as a portrait painter.

title: Hans Krell
text: He is thought to have been born in Crailsheim or Ansbach, and died in Leipzig.

title: Hans Krell
text: Hans Krell started his career as court painter of George the Pious, Margrave of Brandenburg- Ansbach in Ansbach.

title: Hans Krell
text: Then he entered into the service of King Louis II of Hungary in Prague and Buda, where he was employed as court portraitist in the years 1522- 1526.

title: Hans Krell
text: Then he is recorded in Leipzig( from 1531) and in Freiberg in Saxony( since 1534).

title: Hans Krell
text: Krell was known as the" Fürstenmaler"( Painter of Princes) in service of the German Princes- Albrecht of Brandenburg- Ansbach, Duke in Prussia, Hedwig Jagiellon, Electress of Brandenburg and the Elector Augustus of Saxony.

title: Hans Krell
text: Hans Krell is credited by Dieter Koepplin as the author of a painting long associated with Lucas Cranach the Elder or his workshop-" Battle of Orsha", painted around 1524- 1530.

title: Hans Krell
text: The painting, today displayed in the National Museum in Warsaw, depicts the battle which was fought on 8 September 1514 between the allied forces of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania and Kingdom of Poland and the army of Grand Duchy of Moscow.

title: Hans Krell
text: According to the specialists, the author must have taken part in the battle himself due to high knowledge of the subject.

title: Hans Krell
text: Krell's connections with the Jagiellonian dynasty patrons( including King of Hungary) and rulers of Prussia makes this attribution highly probable.

title: Hans Krell
text: The author of the painting portraited himself in the painting observing the battle and gazing upwards through intertwined fingers.

title: Shonali Bose
text: Shonali Bose( born 3 June 1965) is an Indian film director, writer and film producer.

title: Shonali Bose
text: Having made her feature film debut in 2005, she has since won such accolades as a National Film Award, a Bridgestone Narrative Award, and a Sundance Mahindra Global Filmmaker Award.

title: Shonali Bose
text: Bose earned her breakthrough with her first feature film, the 2005 biographical drama" Amu", which was based on her own novel of the same name.

title: Shonali Bose
text: The film which chronicles the attacks on Sikhs in Delhi in 1984, garnered critical acclaim and the National Film Award for Best Feature Film in English.

title: Shonali Bose
text: Bose then worked as the assistant director for the 2012 war film" Chittagong", which she also co-wrote.

title: Shonali Bose
text: Bose's status as a filmmaker grew following the critical and commercial success of the dramas" Margarita with a Straw"( 2015) and" The Sky Is Pink"( 2019).

title: Shonali Bose
text: Inspired from the life of Malini Chib—her cousin and a disability rights activist, the former earned Bose a Sundance Mahindra Global Filmmaker Award and a NETPAC Award.

title: Shonali Bose
text: Bose is also an active philanthropist and supports various charitable organisations.

title: Shonali Bose
text: She was married to filmmaker Bedabrata Pain, but the couple separated following the death of their son.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Margarita with a Straw is a 2014 Indian drama film directed by Shonali Bose.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: It stars Kalki Koechlin as an Indian teenager with cerebral palsy who relocates to America for her undergraduate education and comes of age following her complex relationship with a blind girl, played by Sayani Gupta.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Revathi, Kuljeet Singh, and William Moseley play supporting roles.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Produced by Bose in partnership with Viacom18 Motion Pictures, "Margarita with a Straw" was co-written by Bose and Nilesh Maniyar and deals with themes of inclusion, self-acceptance, and human sexuality.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Bose conceived the idea for the film in January 2011, during a conversation with Malini Chib—her cousin and a disability rights activist—about the latter's desire to have a normal sex life.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Inspired by Chib's story, Bose wrote the first draft of the film's script.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: After winning a Sundance Mahindra Global Filmmaker Award for the draft, she modified the script to reflect her own perspective, incorporating several personal experiences into the narrative.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Bose completed the screenplay with co-writer Maniyar and the advisory council of the Sundance Institute.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Bose was keen to cast an actress with cerebral palsy for the central part, but eventually hired Koechlin, who learnt the movements and speech patterns of people with the disorder.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Filming took place in Delhi and New York in 2013, with Anne Misawa as the director of photography.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: The film was selected for the National Film Development Corporation of India's Work-in-Progress Lab initiative during post-production, which was completed in the latter half of 2013.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: The soundtrack for the film was composed by Mikey McCleary.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: "Margarita with a Straw" premiered at the 2014 Toronto International Film Festival.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: It was also screened at the Tallinn Black Nights, the BFI London, the Vesoul Festival of Asian Cinema, and the Galway Film Fleadh.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: The film was released theatrically in India on 17 April 2015 to positive reviews.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Commentators praised most aspects of the production, Koechlin's performance, and Bose's direction.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Koechlin won the Screen Award for Best Actress and the National Film Award – Special Jury Award, and Bose won the NETPAC Award at Toronto.

title: Margarita with a Straw
text: Commercially, "Margarita with a Straw" grossed over 74 million against a production budget of 65 million.

title: Quintus Petillius Cerialis
text: Quintus Petillius Cerialis Caesius Rufus, otherwise known as Quintus Petillius Cerialis (born ca.

title: Quintus Petillius Cerialis
text: AD 30—died after AD 83) was a Roman general and administrator who served in Britain during Boudica's rebellion and who went on to participate in the civil wars after the death of Nero.

title: Quintus Petillius Cerialis
text: He later crushed the rebellion of Julius Civilis and returned to Britain as its governor.

title: Quintus Petillius Cerialis
text: Because he probably succeeded Caesius Nasica as commander of Legio IX Hispana, and since brothers are often attested as serving in succession in the same post, Anthony Birley suggests that Cerialis was the younger brother of Nasica, and had been adopted by Petillius Rufus, who was known as praetor in AD 28. However, in his monograph of naming practices in the first centuries of the Roman Empire Olli Salomies argues that Cerialis was actually the biological son of Petillius Rufus by a Caesia, who may have been the daughter of a Caesius Cerialis, and Caesius Nasica would not be his brother, "but a close relative.

title: Domitilla the Younger
text: Flavia Domitilla the Younger or Flavia Domitilla Minor( c.

title: Domitilla the Younger
text: 66) was the only daughter of the Roman Emperor Vespasian and Flavia Domitilla the Elder.

title: Domitilla the Younger
text: Her elder brother was Titus, and her younger brother Domitian.

title: Domitilla the Younger
text: At the age of fifteen, she was married to Quintus Petillius Cerialis, with whom she had a daughter, the later Christian saint Flavia Domitilla.

title: Domitilla the Younger
text: Domitilla died before Vespasian became emperor in 69.

title: Domitilla the Younger
text: She was later deified by her younger brother Domitian, who also bestowed the honorific title of" Augusta" upon her.

title: Flavia Domitilla (saint)
text: Flavia Domitilla, daughter of Domitilla the Younger by an unknown father, perhaps Quintus Petillius Cerialis, had the same name as her mother and her grandmother Domitilla the Elder. She was thus a granddaughter of Emperor Vespasian and a niece of Emperors Titus and Domitian.

title: Flavia Domitilla (saint)
text: She married her cousin, the consul Titus Flavius Clemens, a grand-nephew of Vespasian through his father Titus Flavius Sabinus (consul AD 69).

title: Flavia Domitilla (saint)
text: There is disagreement about whether the Flavia Domitilla mentioned in certain fourth-century and later Christian writings is the same person or another.

title: Christoph Friedrich von Ammon
text: Christoph Friedrich von Ammon (January 16, 1766 – May 21, 1850) was a German theological writer and preacher.

title: Christoph Friedrich von Ammon
text: He was born at Bayreuth, Bavaria and died at Dresden.

title: Christoph Friedrich von Ammon
text: He studied at Erlangen, held various professorships in the philosophical and theological faculties of Erlangen and Göttingen, succeeded Franz Volkmar Reinhard (1753–1812) in 1813 as court preacher and member of the Upper Consistory of the Church of Saxony at Dresden, retired from these offices in 1849.

title: Christoph Friedrich von Ammon
text: Seeking to establish for himself a middle position between rationalism and supernaturalism, he declared for a "rational supernaturalism," and contended that there must be a gradual development of Christian doctrine corresponding to the advance of knowledge and science.

title: Christoph Friedrich von Ammon
text: But at the same time he sought, like other representatives of this school of thought, such as KG Bretschneider and Julius Wegscheider, to keep in close touch with the historical theology of the Protestant churches.

title: Christoph Friedrich von Ammon
text: The term "Offenbarungsrationalismusepiphanic rationalism") has been used to express Ammon's intermediate views.

title: Christoph Friedrich von Ammon
text: He was a man of great versatility and extensive learning, a philologist and philosopher as well as a theologian, and a very voluminous author.

title: Christoph Friedrich von Ammon
text: His principal theological work was the Fortbildung des Christenthums zur Weltreligion, in 4 volumes (Leipzig, 1833–1840); Entwurf einer reinen biblischen Theologie appeared in 1792 (2nd edition, 1801), Summa Theologiae Christianas in 1803 (other editions, 1808, 1816, 1830); Das Geschichte des Lebens Jesu in 1842, and Die wahre und falsche Orthodoxie in 1849.

title: Christoph Friedrich von Ammon
text: Von Ammon's style in preaching was terse and lively, and some of his discourses are regarded as models of pulpit treatment of political questions.

title: Peter Ammon
text: Peter Ammon( born in Frankfurt/ Main on 23 February 1952) is a German diplomat and was Ambassador of the Federal Republic of Germany to the United Kingdom from May 2014 until 31 January 2018.

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: Friedrich August von Ammon (10 September 1799 – 18 May 1861) was a German surgeon and ophthalmologist born in Göttingen.

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: He was the son of theologian Christoph Friedrich von Ammon (1766–1850).

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: He studied medicine at the Universities of Göttingen and Leipzig, and following an educational journey through Germany and Paris, he settled in Dresden in 1823 as a physician.

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: Here his primary focus dealt with surgical and surgical-anatomical duties.

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: In 1828 he attained the title of professor, becoming director of the surgical-medical academy in Dresden.

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: In 1837 he was named royal physician to Friedrich August II, King of Saxony.

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: Known for his work in ophthalmology, he was instrumental in making Dresden a center of ophthalmic learning during his lifetime.

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: In 1830 founded "Zeitschrift für die Ophthalmologie", an early journal devoted to ophthalmology.

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: In his prize-winning book, "De Iritide" (1835), he made contributions involving investigations of iritis and sympathetic ophthalmia.

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: His most ambitious written effort in the field of ophthalmology was "Klinische Darstellung der Krankheiten und Bildungsfehler des menschlichen Auges", a monograph acclaimed for its comprehensive treatment of eye disease, as well as for its superb hand-colored illustrations and its descriptions of congenital eye anomalies.

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: One of Ammon's earlier works was an impartial comparative study between French and German surgery titled "Vergleich zwischen französischer und deutscher Chirurgie" (1823).

title: Friedrich August von Ammon
text: In 1842 he co-authored a significant book on plastic surgery, "Die plastische Chirurgie".

title: The Weekly Standard
text: The Weekly Standard was an American political magazine of news, analysis and commentary that used to be published 48 times per year.

title: The Weekly Standard
text: Originally edited by founders Bill Kristol and Fred Barnes, the "Standard" had been described as a "redoubt of neoconservatism" and as "the neo-con bible".

title: The Weekly Standard
text: Its founding publisher, News Corporation, debuted the title on September 18, 1995.

title: The Weekly Standard
text: In 2009, News Corporation sold the magazine to a subsidiary of the Anschutz Corporation.

title: The Weekly Standard
text: On December 14, 2018, its owners announced that the magazine was ceasing publication, with the last issue published on December 17.

title: The Weekly Standard
text: Many of the magazine's articles were written by members of conservative think tanks located in Washington, including the American Enterprise Institute, the Ethics and Public Policy Center, the Foundation for Defense of Democracies, the Hudson Institute, and the Foreign Policy Initiative.

title: The Weekly Standard
text: Individuals who wrote for the magazine included Elliott Abrams, Peter Berkowitz, John R. Bolton, Ellen Bork, David Brooks, Gertrude Himmelfarb, Christopher Hitchens, Harvey Mansfield, Cynthia Ozick, Joe Queenan, and John Yoo.

title: The Weekly Standard
text: The magazine's website also produced regular online-only commentaries and news articles.

title: The Weekly Standard
text: The site's editorial stance was described as neo-conservative.

text: At the time of the 9/11 attacks, Smith was working as an editor at" The Village Voice" and a contributor to" Artforum".

title: Lee Smith (journalist)
text: By his own account in his book," The Strong Horse", Smith was dissatisfied with the Orientalist explanations of the Muslim world as presented by Edward Said, whom he had met and spoken with about the region. As a result, he took a job as a foreign correspondent for" The Weekly Standard" and spent years reporting from the region.

title: News Corporation (1980–2013)
text: The original incarnation of News Corporation (abbreviated News Corp.

title: News Corporation (1980–2013)
text: ) was an American multinational mass media corporation operated and owned by media mogul, Rupert Murdoch, headquartered in New York City.

title: News Corporation (1980–2013)
text: Prior to its split in 2013, it was the world's fourth-largest media group in terms of revenue, and News Corporation had become a media powerhouse since its inception, almost dominating the news, television, film and print industries.

title: News Corporation (1980–2013)
text: News Corporation was a publicly traded company listed on NASDAQ.

title: News Corporation (1980–2013)
text: Formerly incorporated in Adelaide, South Australia, the company was re-incorporated under Delaware General Corporation Law after a majority of shareholders approved the move on November 12, 2004.

title: News Corporation (1980–2013)
text: News Corporation was headquartered at 1211 Avenue of the Americas, New York, in the newer 1960s–1970s corridor of the Rockefeller Center complex.

title: News Corporation (1980–2013)
text: On June 28, 2012, after concerns from shareholders in response to its recent scandals and to "unlock even greater long-term shareholder value", founder Rupert Murdoch announced that News Corporation's assets would be split into two publicly traded companies, one oriented towards media, and the other towards publishing.

title: News Corporation (1980–2013)
text: The corporate spin-off formally took place on June 28, 2013; where the present News Corp. was renamed 21st Century Fox and consists primarily of media outlets, while a new News Corp was formed to take on the publishing and Australian broadcasting assets.

title: News Corporation (1980–2013)
text: Its major holdings at the time of the split were News Limited (a group of newspaper publishers in Murdoch's native Australia), News International (a newspaper publisher in the United Kingdom, whose properties include "The TimesThe Sun", and the now-defunct "News of the World"—which was the subject of a phone hacking scandal that led to its closure in July 2011), Dow Jones & Company (an American publisher of financial news outlets, including "The Wall Street Journal"), the book publisher HarperCollins, and the Fox Entertainment Group (owners of the 20th Century Fox film studio and the Fox Broadcasting Company—one of the United States' major television networks).

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: Mujīr ad- Dīn ʿ Abd al- Dawla Abu Saʿīd Ābaq ibn Jamāl ad- Dīn Muhammad( died 1169) was the governor of Damascus from 1140 to 1154.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: He was the eldest son of Jamal ad- Din Muhammad.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: After the death of his father in 1140, Mujir ad- Din succeeded his father as governor in 1140.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: As he was still a minor, Mu'in ad- Din Unur was named vizier.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: Zengi attacked Damascus, hoping to take advantage of Jamal ad- Din's death, but Mu'in ad- Din effectively organized the defense of the city.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: When this regent died in July 1149, Mujir ad- Din took his place as the rightful heir of Damascus. He was a weak ruler, however, and Damascus came under the influence of Nur ad- Din Zangi, emir of Aleppo and Mosul, who had imposed his dominance over the city in the aftermath of the Second Crusade.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: In 1150 Nur ad- Din recognized Mujir ad- Din as ruler of Damascus, but in 1151 Mujir ad- Din allied with the crusaders against Bosra, angering Nur ad- Din.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: Later that year Mujir ad- Din visited Aleppo and swore to remain loyal to Nur ad- Din.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: In 1152 Mujir ad- Din again besieged Bosra, until the governor of the city agreed to his demands and he returned to Damascus.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: In 1153 Mujir ad- Din joined Nur ad- Din in the capture of the crusader castle at Baniyas.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: In 1154 the two were in conflict again, and Nur ad- Din finally occupied Damascus by force, exiling Mujir ad- Din to Homs.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: Nur ad- Din was fully in control of the city and all of Syria.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: Mujir ad- Din later left Homs for Baghdad.

title: Mujir ad-Din Abaq
text: His honorific title" Mujīr ad- Dīn" means" protector of the faith".

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth( POB) or birthplace is the place where a person was born.

title: Place of birth
text: This place is often used in legal documents, together with name and date of birth, to uniquely identify a person.

title: Place of birth
text: As a general rule with respect to passports, the place of birth is determined to be the country that currently has" sovereignty" over the actual place of birth, regardless of when the birth actually occurred.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth is not necessarily the place where the parents of the new baby live.

title: Place of birth
text: If the baby is born in a hospital in another place, that place is the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In many countries, this also means that the government requires that the birth of the new baby is registered in the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: Some countries place less or no importance on the place of birth, instead using alternative geographical characteristics for the purpose of identity documents.

title: Place of birth
text: For example, Sweden has used the concept of" födelsehemortdomicile of birth") since 1947.

title: Place of birth
text: This means that the domicile of the baby's mother is the registered place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: The location of the maternity ward or other physical birthplace is considered unimportant.

title: Place of birth
text: Similarly, Switzerland uses the concept of" Heimatortlieu d'origineluogo d'origineplace of origin" in German, French and Italian respectively).

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to Swiss parents is automatically assigned the place of origin of the parent with the same last name, so the child either gets their mother's or father's place of origin.

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to one Swiss parent and one foreign parent acquires the place of origin of their Swiss parent.

title: Place of birth
text: In a Swiss passport and identity card, the holder's place of origin is stated, not their place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In some countries( primarily in the Americas), the place of birth automatically determines the nationality of the baby, a practice often referred to by the Latin phrase" jus soli".

title: Place of birth
text: Almost all countries outside the Americas instead attribute nationality based on the nationality( ies) of the baby's parents( referred to as" jus sanguinis").

title: Place of birth
text: There can be some confusion regarding the place of birth if the birth takes place in an unusual way: when babies are born on an airplane or at sea, difficulties can arise.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth of such a person depends on the law of the countries involved, which include the nationality of the plane or ship, the nationality( ies) of the parents and/ or the location of the plane or ship( if the birth occurs in the territorial waters or airspace of a country).

title: Place of birth
text: Some administrative forms may request the applicant's" country of birth".

title: Place of birth
text: It is important to determine from the requester whether the information requested refers to the applicant's" place of birth" or" nationality at birth".

title: Place of birth
text: For US citizens born abroad who under the US Constitution acquire US citizenship at the time of birth, the nationality at birth will be USA( American), while the place of birth would be the country in which the actual birth takes place.

title: Sennedjem
text: The Ancient Egyptian artisan Sennedjem lived in Set Maat( translated as" The Place of Truth"), contemporary Deir el- Medina, on the west bank of the Nile, opposite Thebes, during the reigns of Seti I and Ramesses II.

title: Sennedjem
text: Sennedjem had the title" Servant in the Place of Truth".

title: Sennedjem
text: He was buried along with his wife, Iyneferti, and family in a tomb in the village necropolis.

title: Sennedjem
text: His tomb was discovered January 31, 1886.

title: Sennedjem
text: When Sennedjem's tomb was found, in it there was regular furniture from his home, including a stool and a bed, which he actually used when he was alive.

title: Sennedjem
text: His titles included Servant in the Place of Truth, meaning that he worked on the excavation and decoration of the nearby royal tombs.

title: Robert W. Scott
text: Robert Walter "Bob" Scott (June 13, 1929 – January 23, 2009) was an American politician who served as the 67th Governor of North Carolina from 1969 to 1973.

title: Robert W. Scott
text: He was born and died in Haw River, North Carolina.

title: Robert W. Scott
text: The son of North Carolina Governor W. Kerr Scott, and grandson and nephew of state legislators, Scott was a dairy farmer before being elected to the post of lieutenant governor in 1964 and that of governor in 1968.

title: Robert W. Scott
text: In May 1969, during his term as governor, racial violence at North Carolina Agricultural & Technical State University, a predominantly black campus in Greensboro, resulted in one student death, and the injury of a National Guardsman, five Greensboro police officers and two students.

title: Robert W. Scott
text: Constitutionally barred from seeking another term, he later served as co-chairman of the Appalachian Regional Commission and as President of the North Carolina Community College System, from 1983 until 1995.

title: Robert W. Scott
text: Scott unsuccessfully ran for governor in 1980, losing in the Democratic primary to Jim Hunt.

title: Robert W. Scott
text: His daughter, Meg Scott Phipps served as North Carolina Commissioner of Agriculture from 2001 to 2003.

title: Robert W. Scott
text: Scott was honored in 2008 by the North Carolina Society for preserving state archives and historic artifacts and his efforts to increase awareness of the state's history.

title: Robert W. Scott
text: Scott died in 2009 at the age of 79 and is buried in Hawfields Presbyterian Church Cemetery in Mebane, North Carolina.

title: Robert W. Scott
text: His father's farm and birthplace, the Kerr Scott Farm, was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1987.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: Sjumandjaja( Perfected Spelling: Syumanjaya; 5 August 1934 – 19 July 1985) was an Indonesian director, screenwriter, and actor.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: During his career he wrote numerous films, directed fourteen, acted in ten, and produced nine; he also won five Citra Awards from the Indonesian Film Festival.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: His films reflected social realism.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: Sjumandjaja was born in Batavia( modern day Jakarta), Dutch East Indies, and grew up there.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: During high school, he became interested in creative writing and acting, eventually joining the Senen Artists' Group.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: In 1956, when one of his short stories was adapted into a film, Sjumandjaja became active in the filmmaking industry, writing two films for the production company Persari.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: After receiving a government scholarship, he moved to Moscow and attended the All- Union State Institute of Cinematography.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: Upon returning to Indonesia in 1965, Sjumandjaja took a job at the Ministry of Information and continued writing screenplays.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: In 1971, after leaving the ministry, he directed his first feature film," Lewat Tengah MalamPast Midnight").

title: Sjumandjaja
text: He continued to write and direct films until his death from a heart attack on 19 July 1985.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: Reportedly a strict director, Sjumandjaja valued creative value over receiving a director's fee.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: He married three times and had three children, two with his first wife and one with his second.

title: Sjumandjaja
text: His son, Sri Aksana, is the former drummer of Dewa 19, and his daughter Djenar Maesa Ayu is also a Citra Award- winning director.

title: The Bilingual Lover

title: The Bilingual Lover

title: The Bilingual Lover

title: Vicente Aranda
text: Vicente Aranda Ezquerra (9 November 1926 – 26 May 2015) was a Spanish film director, screenwriter and producer.

title: Vicente Aranda
text: Due to his refined and personal style, he was one of the most renowned Spanish filmmakers.

title: Vicente Aranda
text: He started as a founding member of the Barcelona School of Film and became known for bringing contemporary Spanish novels to life on the big screen.

title: Vicente Aranda
text: Aranda was also noted for exploring difficult social issues and variations on the theme of desire while using the codes of melodrama.

title: Vicente Aranda
text: Love as uncontrollable passion, eroticism and cruelty are constant themes in his filmography.

title: Vicente Aranda
text: The frank examination of sexuality is one of the trademarks of his work, as seen in his most internationally successful film: "Amantes" (1990) "(Lovers)".

title: Chris Carter (screenwriter)
text: Christopher Carl Carter (born October 13, 1956) is an American television and film producer, director and writer.

title: Chris Carter (screenwriter)
text: Born in Bellflower, California, Carter graduated with a degree in journalism from California State University, Long Beach before spending thirteen years working for "Surfing Magazine".

title: Chris Carter (screenwriter)
text: After beginning his television career working on television films for Walt Disney Studios, Carter rose to fame in the early 1990s after creating the science fiction-supernatural television series "The X-Files" for the Fox network.

title: Chris Carter (screenwriter)
text: " The X-Files" earned high viewership ratings, and led to Carter's being able to negotiate the creation of future series.

title: Chris Carter (screenwriter)
text: Carter has his own television production company, Ten Thirteen Productions, wherein he went on to create three more series for the network—"Millennium", a doomsday-themed series which met with critical approval and low viewer numbers; "Harsh Realm", which was canceled after three episodes had aired; and "The Lone Gunmen", a spin-off of "The X-Files" which lasted for a single season.

title: Chris Carter (screenwriter)
text: Carter's film roles include writing both of "The X-Files" cinematic spin-offs—1998's successful "The X-Files" and the poorly received 2008 follow-up , the latter of which he also directed—while his television credits have earned him several accolades including eight Primetime Emmy Award nominations.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: The X-Files: I Want to Believe is a 2008 American supernatural thriller film directed by Chris Carter and written by both Carter and Frank Spotnitz.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: It is the second feature film installment of "The X-Files" franchise created by Carter, following the 1998 film.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: Three main actors from the television series, David Duchovny, Gillian Anderson, and Mitch Pileggi, reappear in the film to reprise their respective roles as Fox Mulder, Dana Scully, and Walter Skinner.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: Unlike the first film, the plot does not focus on the series' ongoing extraterrestrial-based mytharc themes, but instead works as a standalone thriller horror story, like many of the monster-of-the-week episodes frequently seen in the TV series, as well as focusing on the personal relationship between Mulder and Scully.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: The story follows Mulder and Scully who have been out of the FBI for several years, with Mulder living in isolation and Scully having become a doctor at a Catholic hospital, where she has formed a bond with a critically ill child patient.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: When an FBI agent is mysteriously kidnapped and a former Catholic priest who has been convicted of pedaphilia claims to be experiencing psychic visions of the endangered agent, Scully is asked to bring Mulder back to the bureau to consult on the case because of his work with psychics.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: The narrative goes through the push and pull of his at-first reluctant involvement and Scully ’s attempts to stay out of it.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: The film was first anticipated in November 2001 to follow the conclusion of the ninth season of the television series, but it remained in development hell for six years before entering production in December 2007 in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: The film premiered on July 23, 2008, at Grauman's Chinese Theatre in Hollywood before opening theatrically two days later on July 25.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: The worldwide gross was $68.4 million from a $30 million budget.

title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
text: The critical consensus on Rotten Tomatoes praises the chemistry between Duchovny and Anderson but criticizes the plot.

title: Alma Bennett Morgan
text: Alma Bennett Morgan (24 June 1877 – 4 April 1960) was the wife of former Governor of West Virginia Ephraim F. Morgan and served as West Virginia's First Lady from 1921-1925.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: Ephraim Franklin Morgan (January 16, 1869January 15, 1950) was born on a farm near Forksburg, Marion County, West Virginia, a descendant of the first white settler of western Virginia, Morgan Morgan, and his son David Morgan.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: He studied at Fairmont State Normal School and graduated from the West Virginia University law school in 1897.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: After establishing a law practice in Fairmont, Morgan enlisted in the First West Virginia Infantry during the Spanish–American War.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: Following the war, he became the Fairmont city attorney.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: He served as a judge of the Marion County Intermediate Court from 1907 to 1912 and as a member of the West Virginia Public Service Commission from 1915 to 1920.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: In 1902, he married Alma Bennett.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: At the time Morgan became governor, a virtual state of war existed between union coal miners and coal operators.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: The United Mine Workers union was protesting for the right to organize miners in the southwestern part of the state.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: In late summer 1921, the governor called upon President Warren G. Harding to dispatch federal troops to end an armed miners' march in Boone and Logan counties.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: After the conflict ended, Morgan used National Guard troops to discourage miners from again taking up arms.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: A more detailed discussion of the 1921 armed miners' march and the Battle of Blair Mountain can be found in Clayton D. Laurie's "The United States Army and the Return to Normalcy in Labor Dispute Interventions: The Case of the West Virginia Coal Mine Wars, 1920–1921" in "West Virginia History", Volume 50 (1991).

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: Under Morgan, the legislature created a sinking fund to provide financial assistance to new programs, namely a new road system.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: He appointed a Capitol Commission to devise a plan for replacing the old state capitol, which was destroyed by fire on January 3, 1921.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: The west wing of the present state capitol was completed in 1925.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: One week before leaving office, Ephraim and Alma Morgan became the first residents of the present West Virginia Governor's Mansion.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: After his term as governor, Morgan served as solicitor for the United States Department of Commerce before retiring in Fairmont, West Virginia.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: In 1940, he was defeated for the Republican nomination for the United States Senate.

title: Ephraim F. Morgan
text: He died in Bethesda, Maryland, on January 15, 1950, one day before his 81st birthday.

title: Jean-Pierre Melville

title: Louis de Buade de Frontenac
text: Louis de Buade, Comte de Frontenac et de Palluau (22 May 162228 November 1698) was a French soldier, courtier, and Governor General of New France from 1672 to 1682 and from 1689 to his death in 1698.

title: Louis de Buade de Frontenac
text: He established a number of forts on the Great Lakes and engaged in a series of battles against the English and the Iroquois.

title: Louis de Buade de Frontenac
text: In his first term, he supported the expansion of the fur trade, establishing Fort Frontenac (in what is now Kingston, Ontario) and came into conflict with the other members of the Sovereign Council over its expansion and over the corvées required to build the new forts.

title: Louis de Buade de Frontenac
text: In particular, despite the opposition of bishop François de Laval, he supported selling brandy to the aboriginal tribes, which Laval considered a mortal sin.

title: Louis de Buade de Frontenac
text: The conflict with the Sovereign Council led to his recall in 1682.

title: Louis de Buade de Frontenac
text: His second term was characterised by the defence of Quebec from a British invasion during King William's War, a successful guerrilla campaign against the Iroquois and English settlements which resulted in the elimination of the Iroquois threat against New France, and a large expansion of the fur trade using Canadian "coureurs des bois".

title: Louis de Buade de Frontenac
text: He died before his second recall to France.

title: Louise Marie de La Grange d'Arquien
text: She also suffered 10 miscarriages between 1668 and 1683.

title: Louise Marie de La Grange d'Arquien
text: She died in Paris in 1728.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: Magdelaine de La Grange( c.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: 1641–1679) was a French fortune- teller involved in the" Affair of the Poisons".

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: Her arrest in 1677 marked the opening of the official investigation.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: She appealed to François- Michel le Tellier, Marquis de Louvois claiming that she had information about other crimes of high importance.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: Louvois reported to the King, who told Gabriel Nicolas de la Reynie, who, among other things, was the chief of the Paris police, to root out the poisoners.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: Magdelaine de La Grange worked as a fortune teller after the execution of her husband for receiving stolen goods.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: Her specialty was to reveal to clients who were worried about their health that they had been poisoned, and offer them antidotes.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: Since 1669, she lived in luxury at the expense of the rich lawyer Jean Faurye.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: On 17 August 1676, Magdelaine de La Grange and a man who introduced himself as Faurye appeared before a law clerk.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: The man said that they were married, and had a will issued to the benefit of his spouse, Magdelaine de La Grange.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: Shortly after, Jean Faurye died, and his family reported the matter.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: The marriage certificate proved to be a forgery issued by Abbé Nail, who had appeared as Faurye at the law clerk's office.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: After having established a link between her and Louis de Vanens, the case convinced Gabriel Nicolas de la Reynie that there existed a network of poisoners in Paris, and de La Grange and Nial were kept without trial for months for questioning. She never revealed anything of real importance, however, and after the arrest of Marie Bosse in 1679, the trial against her was allowed to proceed.

title: Magdelaine de La Grange
text: Magdelaine de La Grange and Abbé Nail were sentenced to death for forgery and murder on 4 February 1679, and four days later they were hanged.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Shu Yu of Tang, surname( 姓): Ji( 姬) given name( 名): Yu( 虞), and Ziyu( 子於), was the founder of the State of Tang during the early Zhou Dynasty( 1046 – 771 BC) of ancient China.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: The State of Tang would later be renamed Jin by Shu Yu's son and successor, Xie.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: He was the son of King Wu of Zhou and the younger brother of King Cheng of Zhou.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Shortly after the establishment of the Zhou Dynasty, King Wu of Zhou died.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: His son, Prince Song, ascended the throne and became King Cheng of Zhou.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Since he was very young and too inexperienced to run the newly founded dynasty, his uncle, the Duke of Zhou, served as regent and handled all political affairs until King Cheng of Zhou became old enough to rule.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: In the year that King Cheng of Zhou ascended the throne, the people of a land called Tang( 唐) rebelled, so the Duke of Zhou conquered them.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: According to the Records of the Grand Historian, one day, King Cheng of Zhou was playing with his younger brother, Prince Yu.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: King Cheng of Zhou suddenly picked up a parasol tree leaf and gave it to Prince Yu.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Then he said playfully," Let this be a proof that I will make you a feudal lord.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: " Prince Yu happily got the leaf and he then told this to the Duke of Zhou.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: The Duke of Zhou thought that whatever the young King Cheng of Zhou said should not be taken lightly since he was the king.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: The Duke of Zhou approached the young king and asked him if it were true.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: The young king said that he was just joking with his brother.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Then the Duke of Zhou replied," A sovereign must not joke about the things he says and do as what he has said.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: " The young king thought it was reasonable and gave the recent conquered called Tang land, west of modern Yicheng County in Shanxi, to his brother, Prince Yu.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Shu Yu's son and successor, Xie, moved the capital Jiang( 绛) nearer to the Jin River and renamed the state Jin.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Jinci was a shrine in Taiyuan dedicated to Shu Yu.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: It is a major historical and cultural site protected at the national level in People's republic of China.

title: Fa Zhen
text: Fa Zhen( 100–188), courtesy name Gaoqing, art name Xuande Xiansheng, was a reclusive scholar who lived in the Eastern Han dynasty.

title: Fa Zhen
text: He was the grandfather of Fa Zheng, a chief adviser to the warlord Liu Bei, who founded the state of Shu Han in the Three Kingdoms era.

title: Xiefu
text: Xiefu or Xie was the original Marquis of Jin , and the second ruler of the State of Jin during the early Zhou Dynasty.

title: Xiefu
text: His ancestral name was Ji (姬), and given name Xie (燮) or Xiefu (燮父).

title: Xiefu
text: Marquis Xie succeeded his father, Shu Yu of Tang, as the ruler of the state of Tang.

title: Xiefu
text: During his reign, he moved the capital from Tang (唐) to Jin (晉) and renamed the state Jin.

title: Xiefu
text: After he died, his son Ningzu succeeded him as Marquis Wu of Jin.

title: Zhuge Qiao

title: Zhuge Qiao

title: Zhuge Qiao
text: His biological father was Zhuge Liang's elder brother Zhuge Jin, a military general of Shu's ally state, Eastern Wu.

title: Fan Jian

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: King Wu of Zhou was the first king of the Zhou dynasty of ancient China.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: The chronology of his reign is disputed but is generally thought to have begun around 1046 BC and ended three years later in 1043 BC.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: King Wu's ancestral name was Ji and given name Fa .

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: He was the second son of King Wen of Zhou and Queen Taisi.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: In most accounts, his older brother Bo Yikao was said to have predeceased his father, typically at the hands of King Zhou, the last king of the Shang dynasty; in the "Book of Rites", however, it is assumed that his inheritance represented an older tradition among the Zhou of passing over the eldest son.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: (Fa's grandfather Jili had likewise inherited Zhou despite two older brothers.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: ) Upon his succession, Fa worked with his father-in-law Jiang Ziya to accomplish an unfinished task: overthrowing the Shang dynasty.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: In 1048 BC, Fa marched down the Yellow River to the Mengjin ford and met with more than 800 dukes.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: He constructed an ancestral tablet naming his father Chang King Wen and placed it on a chariot in the middle of the host; considering the timing unpropitious, though, he did not yet attack Shang.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: In 1046 BC, King Wu took advantage of Shang disunity to launch an attack along with many neighboring dukes.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: The Battle of Muye destroyed Shang's forces and King Zhou of Shang set his palace on fire, dying within.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: King Wu the name means "Martial" followed his victory by establishing many feudal states under his 16 younger brothers and clans allied by marriage, but his death three years later provoked several rebellions against his young heir King Cheng and the regent Duke of Zhou, even from three of his brothers.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: A burial mound in Zhouling town, Xianyang, Shaanxi was once thought to be King Wu's tomb.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: It was fitted with a headstone bearing Wu's name in the Qing dynasty.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: Modern archeology has since concluded that the tomb is not old enough to be from the Zhou dynasty, and is more likely to be that of a Han dynasty royal.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: The true location of King Wu's tomb remains unknown, but is likely to be in the Xianyang-Xi'an area.

title: King Wu of Zhou
text: Wu is considered one of the great heroes of China, together with Yellow Emperor and Yu the Great.

title: Kaya Alp
text: Kaya Alp was, according to Ottoman tradition, the son of Kızıl Buğa and the father of Suleyman Shah, who was, in turn, the grandfather of Ertuğrul, and the great grandfather of the Ottoman Empire founder, Osman I.

title: Ian Barry (director)
text: Ian Barry is an Australian director of film and TV.

title: The Last Performance
text: The Last Performance is a 1927 American horror film directed by Paul Fejos and starring Conrad Veidt and Mary Philbin.

title: The Last Performance
text: It was the last American silent film featuring Veidt before he returned to Germany.

title: The Last Performance
text: The film's working title was "Erik the Great".

title: The Last Performance
text: Two versions were made - a silent version and Movietone version complete with music, talking sequences, and sound effects (the talking sequences were confined only to the last reel).

title: The Last Performance
text: Historian Troy Howarth states "Originally planned as part of Universal's "Super Jewel" series , it was shot in 1927 and got a brief release that same year in New York City.

title: The Last Performance
text: It went into general release in 1929, just as sound films were beginning to catch on.

title: The Last Performance
text: " He continues "Its belated general debut led many to conclude that "Last Performance" was a follow-up to Paul Leni's "The Man Who Laughs" (1928)... However, Fejos' film was made first.

title: The Last Performance
text: " The silent version went into general release at the Little Carnegie Theater in New York City in November 1929.

title: The Last Performance
text: Later release prints contained sound effects, and the Hungarian release prints featured Bela Lugosi overdubbing Conrad Veidt's voice.

title: The Last Performance
text: " The Last Performance" was shot on the same set as the 1925 film "The Phantom of the Opera", and contained an early use of zoom effects.

title: The Last Performance
text: The film received mixed reviews.

title: The Last Performance
text: Troy Howarth states " An interesting rumor has circulated for years among film enthusiasts that Walter Brennan appears in the film as a circus clown, but this is difficult to confirm with any degree of certainty".

title: The Last Performance
text: The silent version (with Danish title cards) was released by the Criterion Collection on Blu-ray and DVD with Fejos' "Lonesome" in August 2012.

title: The Last Performance
text: The dvd release runs about 59 minutes, so "it seems likely that some significant footage is lost.

title: Paul Fejos
text: Pál Fejös, commonly known by Paul Fejos (January 27, 1897 – April 23, 1963), was a Hungarian-born director of feature films and documentaries who worked in a number of countries including the United States.

title: Paul Fejos
text: He also studied medicine in his youth and became a prominent anthropologist later in life.

title: Paul Fejos
text: During World War I, Fejos worked as a medical orderly for the Imperial Austrian Army on the Italian front lines and also managed a theatre that performed for troops.

title: Paul Fejos
text: After the war, he returned to Budapest and eventually worked for the Orient-Film production company.

title: Paul Fejos
text: He began to direct films in 1919 or 1920 for Mobil Studios in Hungary until he escaped in 1923 to flee the White Terror and the Horthy regime.

title: Paul Fejos
text: He made his way to New York City and then eventually to Hollywood where he started production on his first American feature film, "The Last Moment", in October 1927.

title: Paul Fejos
text: As a major hit, the film allowed him to sign with Universal Studios.

title: Paul Fejos
text: After a number of other successful films, Fejos left America in 1931 to direct sound films in France.

title: Paul Fejos
text: In 1941 he stopped making films all together and became the Director of Research and the acting head of the Viking Fund.

title: Robert Treat Paine Jr.
text: Born Thomas Paine (after his paternal grandfather), he changed his name to that of his recently deceased older brother in 1801, in part as a tribute to his father and in part to avoid confusion with the more famous Thomas Paine, the revolutionary pamphleteer, who was unpopular at that time.

title: Robert Treat Paine Jr.
text: He received bachelor's and master's degrees from Harvard University, for whose commencement ceremonies he wrote a number of pieces.

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: Thomas Paine( 1632–1715) was a colonial American privateer who, during the late 17th century, raided several Spanish settlements.

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: He participated in a raid with Jan Willems, looting Rio de la Hacha in 1680 as well as driving the French out of Block Island.

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: In June of the same year, Paine joined forces with Michel de Grammont and a captain named Wright at Blanquilla Island.

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: Together with 50 men they successfully raided the town of Cumana although it was defended by 2,000 Spanish soldiers.

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: A resident of Jamestown, Rhode Island, Paine had received a commission from Jamaica's governor Sir Thomas Lynch which instructed him to" seize, kill, and destroy pirates"; however, in March 1683, he joined the privateers John Markham, Jan Corneliszoon, Conway Woolley and a French Captain" Bréhal"( actually a nickname of Michiel Andrieszoon) in a raid against the Spanish town of Saint Augustine, Florida.

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: In command of an eight- gun barque, the" Pearl", Paine led his crew of sixty men under the command of Captain Bréhal, who possessed a French privateering commission obtained from Jacques Nepveu, sieur de Pouanéay and governor of Saint Domingue.

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: As did the others, Paine sailed under a French flag as the fleet arrived off the Florida coast. However, finding the Spanish had prepared for their arrival in advance, they were forced to withdraw, eventually abandoning their raid after looting the surrounding area( although they did release several captive before their departure).

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: Returning with Bréhal and Markham to New Providence, they were reportedly wanted by governor Robert Lilburne, who wished to detain both Markham and Paine for violating England's peace agreement with Spain; however he was unable to do so" for want of a force", and they eventually left the Bahamas to join Corneliszoon and Woolley in salvaging the wrecked Spanish treasure galleon, the" Nuestra Senora de las Maravillas".

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: Their efforts apparently met little success and he and Bréhal sailed north to resupply at Rhode Island.

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: Although New England was traditionally friendly towards privateers, the two were arrested on orders by visiting governor Edward Cranfield who charged Paine with carrying a counterfeit commission.

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: Paine was eventually cleared and Bréhal allowed to leave.

title: Thomas Paine (privateer)
text: Paine stayed in Rhode Island and eventually went into semi-retirement, becoming involved in the cargo and resailing for local pirates including Captain William Kidd, who visited Paine in 1699.

title: Jim Bonfanti
text: James Alexander Bonfanti( born December 17, 1948 in Windber, Pennsylvania) is a rock drummer, best known as a member of the band Raspberries.

title: Jim Bonfanti
text: Bonfanti's music career began in 1965 when he saw The Beatles on" The Ed Sullivan Show", which eventually led him to join a band called" The Mods", later renamed The Choir.

title: Jim Bonfanti
text: Their recording of" It ’s Cold Outside" reached the national charts in 1967.

title: Jim Bonfanti
text: In 1970, Bonfanti, Wally Bryson, Dave Smalley and Eric Carmen formed Raspberries who made four albums, eight singles, many road trips( including Carnegie Hall), national and international success, including a gold record for their major hit" Go All the Way".

title: Jim Bonfanti
text: Following two albums both released in 1972, creative tension came to a head sparked largely by Carmen's creative dominance over the contributions of fellow members.

title: Jim Bonfanti
text: After the release of the Raspberries' third album," Side 3", Smalley and Bonfanti departed Raspberries to form their own band, Dynamite.

title: Jerzy Sebastian Lubomirski

title: Jerzy Sebastian Lubomirski
text: He was the initiator of the Lubomirski Rebellion of 1665–1666.

title: Jerzy Sebastian Lubomirski

title: Mario Bava
text: Mario Bava( 31 July 1914 – 27 April 1980) was an Italian cinematographer, director, special effects artist and screenwriter, frequently referred to as the" Master of Italian Horror" and the" Master of the Macabre".

title: Mario Bava
text: His low- budget genre films, known for their distinctive visual flair and technical ingenuity, feature recurring themes and imagery concerning the conflict between illusion and reality, and the destructive capacity of human nature.

title: Mario Bava
text: Born to sculptor, cinematographer and special effects pioneer Eugenio Bava, the younger Bava followed his father into the film industry, and eventually earned a reputation as one of Italy's foremost cameramen, lighting and providing the special effects for such films as" Hercules"( 1958) and its sequel" Hercules Unchained"( 1959)( each were lampooned on" Mystery Science Theater 3000").

title: Mario Bava
text: During the late 1950s, his eventual career trajectory as a director began when he was relied upon to complete projects begun by or credited to his colleague Riccardo Freda and other filmmakers, including" I Vampiri"( 1957)( the first Italian horror film of the sound era)," The Day the Sky Exploded"( 1958)( the first Italian science fiction film)," Caltiki – The Immortal Monster"( 1959) and" The Giant of Marathon"( 1959).

title: Mario Bava
text: Although most of Bava's films as director failed to achieve major commercial success upon release, many of them would eventually find acclaim as cult classics, with their content and production values being favourably compared to the works of Alfred Hitchcock.

title: Mario Bava
text: Several of them have been noted for their revolutionary impact on their respective genres:" Black Sunday"( 1960), his official directorial debut, was the forerunner of the Italian gothic horror film cycle;" The Girl Who Knew Too Much"( 1963) is considered to be the first giallo film;" Kill, Baby, Kill"( 1966) heavily influenced the iconography of modern J-Horror;" Roy Colt& Winchester Jack"( 1970) is regarded as one of the earliest self- parodying Spaghetti Westerns;" Four Times That Night"( 1971) was an early Italian sex comedy; and" A Bay of Blood"( 1971) was a precursor to slasher films.

title: Mario Bava
text: His other notable films include" Hercules in the Haunted World"( 1961)," Erik the Conqueror"( 1961)," Black Sabbath"( 1963)," The Whip and the Body"( 1963)," Blood and Black Lace"( 1964)," Planet of the Vampires"( 1965)," Knives of the Avenger"( 1966),( 1968)," Hatchet for the Honeymoon"( 1970)," Five Dolls for an August Moon"( 1970)," Baron Blood"( 1972)," Lisa and the Devil"( 1974)," Rabid Dogs"( 1974) and" Shock"( 1977).

title: Mario Bava
text: Despite his reputation as a talented artist during his lifetime, Bava's shy, self- deprecating demeanour prevented him from taking advantage of opportunities that would have furthered his international standing within the film industry, and he turned down multiple opportunities to work in Hollywood.

title: Mario Bava
text: Among the filmmakers Bava and his work have influenced include Dario Argento, Lucio Fulci, Federico Fellini, John Carpenter, Nicolas Winding Refn, Martin Scorsese, Tim Burton, Joe Dante, John Landis, Francis Ford Coppola, Roger Corman, Edgar Wright, Jennifer Kent and Quentin Tarantino.

title: Mario Bava
text: His son and frequent assistant director, Lamberto Bava, later became a noted fantasy and horror film director in his own right.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: Room is a 2015 independent drama film directed by Lenny Abrahamson and written by Emma Donoghue, based on her 2010 novel of the same name.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: It stars Brie Larson as a woman who has been held captive for seven years and whose 5- year- old son( Jacob Tremblay) was born in captivity.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: Their escape allows the boy to experience the outside world for the first time.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: The film also stars Joan Allen, Sean Bridgers, and William H. Macy.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: The film was a co-production of Canada, Ireland, the United Kingdom, and the United States and was shot in Toronto, with the eponymous set built at Pinewood Toronto Studios.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: The crew designed each part of the set for the room to be removable to provide access for the crew.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: Larson researched trauma and nutrition for her part.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: " Room" premiered at the Telluride Film Festival on September 4, 2015, and later screened at the 2015 Toronto International Film Festival, where it received the People's Choice Award.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: The film was theatrically released in Canada on October 23, 2015 by Elevation Pictures and in the United Kingdom and Ireland on January 15, 2016 by StudioCanal.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: It began a limited theatrical run in the United States on October 16, 2015 by A24.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: " Room" received critical acclaim for Larson's and Tremblay's performances and the storytelling, and grossed$ 36.3 million on a$ 13 million budget.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: Cited as one of the best films of the year," Room" received numerous awards and nominations.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: At the 88th Academy Awards," Room" received four nominations, including Best Picture, and winning Best Actress for Larson.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: It also won nine Canadian Screen Awards, including Best Motion Picture, and seven Irish Film& Television Awards, including Best Film.

title: Room (2015 film)
text: Larson won the BAFTA for Best Actress.

title: On the Nickel
text: On the Nickel is a 1980 feature film written, produced by, and starring Ralph Waite.

title: On the Nickel
text: The film presents the story of Sam( Donald Moffat), a recovering alcoholic who feels dissatisfied with his life of sobriety and goes back in search of the good times he enjoyed with his old friends living on Los Angeles' skid row.

title: On the Nickel
text: ( This includes a section of Fifth Street, which is sometimes called" the Nickel", after the five- cent coin.

title: On the Nickel
text: ) Eventually finding his best friend," C.G."( Waite), still living on the nickel, the two men reminisce, and Sam gets a fresh look at the lifestyle he had once vigorously abandoned.

title: On the Nickel
text: The film is a multi- level odyssey through the slums of L.A., as well as Sam's personal ruminations as he re-evaluates the nostalgia he had felt for the free and bohemian lifestyle of a street person.

title: On the Nickel
text: The film also stars Hal Williams, Penelope Allen, and Jack Kehoe.

title: On the Nickel
text: The original soundtrack was written and performed by Tom Waits.

title: On the Nickel
text: With its offbeat, comedic depiction of life on the streets, the film has maintained a cult following since its initial release, although it passed out of general availability for 20 years and effectively became a" lost" movie.

title: On the Nickel
text: Despite this, occasional showings on American television have kept viewer interest high and have resulted in Mr. Waite's decision to collaborate with producer Thomas Wise, re-edit and restore the feature for DVD and internet release in late 2009.

title: On the Nickel
text: On the Nickel debuted on Blu Ray disc in 2017.

title: On the Nickel
text: Discs are currently mastered in Germany and imported to the U.S. and North America.

title: On the Nickel
text: They are compatible with players in the U.S., Central and South America, Canada, and most of Asia.
